name: GREAT STORY COLLECTIONS

values.comments:
This course, intended for those with no prior background in folklore or knowledge of various cultures , covers anthologies and stories from across all times and places. Each collection displays various techniques of collecting folk materials and making them concrete. Each in its own way also raises different issues of genre, legitimacy, canon formation, cultural values and context.

Overall students enjoyed this course. One student commented that this was one of the best courses they had taken at Penn, while another described the course as “awesome.” Several students also mentioned that the readings, lectures, and discussions for the course were interesting and fun.

Most of the students found Professor Azzolina to be a great teacher: interesting, knowledgeable, and fun. One student described Professor Azzolina as “fantastic.” Students also commented that Professor Azzolina was accessible, and one student mentioned that Professor Azzolina was “very easy going and willing to help and work with the student if they desire it.”

A couple of students mentioned that this course had a large workload. One student commented that there was a lot of reading, and another went on to explain that the course required six papers on seven different books and a midterm. This student went on to say that “the external grader [was] actually quite demanding and sets extremely high expectations.” The student did not recommend this course for someone who wanted to get an “easy A.” This course fulfills the Arts and Letters Sector.
